maintainer merge

Thanks!

```suggestion
theorem sum_sum_bipartiteAbove_eq_sum_sum_bipartiteBelow [âˆ€ a b, Decidable (r a b)]
    [AddCommMonoid R] (f : Î± â†’ Î² â†’ R) :
```
This way you can remove the import to the real numbers.

```suggestion
   simp_rw [card_eq_sum_ones, sum_sum_bipartiteAbove_eq_sum_sum_bipartiteBelow]
```

```suggestion
@[to_additive]
theorem prod_prod_bipartiteAbove_eq_prod_prod_bipartiteBelow
```
You need to swap the two theorems

Swapped them and it works. But can you give me a crash course on how `@[to_additive]` works and why we use it here? The theorem name `prod_prod_bipartiteAbove_eq_prod_prod_bipartiteBelow` implies we're sing a product, but we use sums, but then magically we also have `sum_sum_bipartiteAbove_eq_sum_sum_bipartiteBelow`? Is it just that `AddCommMonoid` is written multiplicatively? But then why do we not need to use products in the theorem statement instead of sums?
`to_additive` is a metaprogram that turns multiplicatively-written statements into additively-written ones. It also guesses the names automatically (but sometimes gets them wrong)
I see, makes sense now that the theorem is written multiplicatively!

```suggestion
  simp_rw [card_eq_sum_ones, sum_sum_bipartiteAbove_eq_sum_sum_bipartiteBelow]
```

```suggestion
    [CommMonoid R] (f : Î± â†’ Î² â†’ R) [âˆ€ a b, Decidable (r a b)] :
    âˆ a âˆˆ s, âˆ b âˆˆ t.bipartiteAbove r a, f a b = âˆ b âˆˆ t, âˆ a âˆˆ s.bipartiteBelow r b, f a b := by
```

```suggestion
  simp_rw [bipartiteAbove, bipartiteBelow, prod_filter]
  exact prod_comm
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: weighted double counting
